title.narrative: Supporting the efficient exercise of Gagauzia's autonomous powers
Supporting the efficient exercise of Gagauzia's autonomous powers

description.narrative: The overall objective of the project is to contribute to effective functioning of Gagauz-Yeri autonomy within the Republic of Moldova through creating a more conducive political environment for dialogue between center and autonomy and enhancing governance capacity to address institutional disputes and legislative contradictions between the center and autonomy. This objective will be reached by focusing the activity on the following: 1) Improve relationships and increased trust between actors in Chisinau and Comrat;2) Improve capacities among members of the dialogue process on Gagauzia and key involved stakeholders from the executive branches on understanding how autonomies function and equip with dialogue skills to engage in joint problem solving in an inclusive manner;3) Improve effectiveness of existing and develop new inclusive institutional mechanisms for more effective Chisinau-Comrat relationships which could deliver legitimate, mutually acceptable solutions and their implementation, responding to the needs of men and women in the autonomy;4) Contribute to the reduction of contradictions in the legislation and develop clarity on the division of competences in political, economic/financial and administrative arrangements governing relationships between the center (Chisinau) and autonomy (Comrat), in an inclusive way that respond to the needs of both women and men.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: During the implementation period, the project made progress towards the overall objective: it contributed to effective functioning of Gagauz-Yeri autonomy within the Republic of Moldova through creating a more conducive political environment for dialogue between center and autonomy and enhancing governance capacity to address institutional disputes and legislative contradictions between the center and autonomy. During this period, the project reached the following key achievements: Creating more conducive political environment: • Normalizing dialogue through creating a viable and legitimate political dialogue platform that can take up controversial and difficult issues and come up with compromise solutions beneficial for the autonomy and the whole country. The three years of dialogue and the period implemented during the project resulted in the establishment and continuous work of a political dialogue which weathered difficult circumstances. Two elections, a serious setback following the changes and the vote of the two out of three laws proposed by the group, as well as the pressure from the international community and the broader society to produce immediate results challenged and made it at times difficult to continue with the work. However, broader commitment of the stakeholders, commitment of WG participants and their joint vision and understanding for longer term benefits as well as the structured support from the project made it possible for the political platform to survive. This has significant impact on understanding and accepting the need for long-term political dialogue and the process which does not bring sweeping and immediate results but remains a viable mechanism for discussing political disagreements and solving problems. Contrasting this with the baseline context in Moldova when no previous dialogue platform on Gagauzia lasted long enough to tackle any issues to satisfaction of the participants – this creates impact level change that can shift narrative and perceptions about the possibilities offered through dialogue making it a practice rather than an anomaly in the long run. • Increased discussion and awareness about the issues with autonomy and need for better governance not only with narrow group of stakeholders but also broadly in the society and among political elite. Although some of these discussions were negative, they created a new topic and revealed limited capacities in nuanced understanding and difference in perceptions about the situation among stakeholder. Emergence of such discussion with its limitations and flaws nevertheless opens up space for both improving quality and expanding the stakeholders engaging contributing to normalization of discussion of autonomy, improved awareness about the issues facing autonomy and the disagreements with Chisinau. Such public discussions and deliberations are important into normalizing public debate and political discussions about autonomy related issues. Without regular and nuanced discussions about the autonomy, longer-term solutions to the improved functioning of Gagauzia ATU can not be found. Results achieved by the group with the changes of culture laws as part of the harmonization effort as well as the achievements in the socio-economic package were also important to creating an alternative narrative about the results of dialogue. • Political dialogue and the work of the WG built awareness and capacities among high level stakeholders in Chisinau and Comrat and led to the discussion of Gagauzia’s place and role in various policy discussions in Chisinau. Autonomy was discussed in the context of the on-going Public Administration and Decentralization reforms in the country, identifying capacity building needs of Gagauz institutions for governance performance. Various activities undertaken by the project had a cumulative effect of bringing Gagauzia related issues on the agenda of Moldovan institutions, having a spillover effect from the project perspective. For instance, when Tax Code was elaborated Gagauzia was included into it in a separate clause without direct engagement of the project. Enhancing Governance Capacity: Enhancement of governance capacity was targeted through the focus of the project on capacity building and expert work which supported the agenda of the WG. One of the major issues identified at the start of the project and the baseline for establishing project outcomes and impact was the limited capacities in both dialogue and problem solving as well as autonomy issues among the key target stakeholders. By addressing this issue through a combination of activities, the project was able to make meaningful contribution to the improved capacities on governance issues in Gagauzia. Over the period of implementation, the project raised awareness and increased capacity among key stakeholders on the need to develop new institutional mechanisms for delineation of competencies, as well as preventive problem- solving and dispute resolution mechanism(s). This is evident from the decisions and major proposals which the WG has come up with in terms of developing institutional mechanisms and improving cooperation and communication through various channels and institutions. The expert work organized and facilitated by CMI contributed to substantiated discussions and producing of the analysis which further enhanced understanding among WG members and broader group of stakeholders about the existing shortcomings in the autonomy functioning. The legal assessment provided better understanding of the legal issues and entrenchment of autonomy and its competencies by Gagauz representatives assisting them to strategically approach the exercise of Gagauzia’s autonomous powers within the existing constitutional framework. These enhanced capacities and produced analysis pose to continue to discussions on how to solve these issues in the future.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
